title: Source: Tucker Carlson ousted by Rupert Murdoch’s son Lachlan and CEO Suzanne Scott
description: Lachlan Murdoch, Rupert Murdoch’s son, and Fox News CEO Suzanne Scott decided to oust Tucker Carlson from the network last Friday, according to a source close to the matter. NBC News’ Stephanie Gosk has the latest.

title: Taliban kill mastermind of Kabul airport bombing that killed 13 U.S. service members
description: The mastermind of the deadly August 2021 attack at Kabul International Airport, which claimed the lives of 13 U.S. service members and more than 150 Afghans seeking to flee the country, has been killed.

title: Proud Boys blame Trump as defendants prepare to find out fate in sedition trial
description: Attorneys for the Proud Boys placed blame for the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol on Donald Trump during closing arguments in the seditious conspiracy trial.

title: A 'pollen storm' is causing many adults to suffer form allergies for the first time
description: When will pollen end? The latest unexpected effect of climate change: adults are getting allergies for the first time as pollen counts soar.

title: Arraignment delayed for man accused of fatally stabbing Cash App founder Bob Lee
description: The arraignment for the man accused of fatally stabbing Cash App founder Bob Lee has been delayed a week, until May 2.

title: Dave Hollis, ex-husband of self-help author Rachel Hollis, had a fatal trio of drugs in his system when he died
description: Dave Hollis, a former Disney executive and ex-husband of celebrated self-help author Rachel Hollis, died of an accidental overdose earlier this year, authorities have determined.

title: Biden vs. Trump 2024 would be the rematch nobody wants
description: President Joe Biden's 2024 campaign launch Tuesday pushes America one step closer to Biden-Trump II, the rematch voters don't want.

title: Here's where extreme heat could be devastating in upcoming years
description: Parts of Asia, Europe and Central America are most at risk of record-breaking heat waves, yet are likely the least prepared to deal with such punishing extremes, according to a new study.

title: Supply of cancer drug Pluvicto should increase in second half of the year, company says
description: Prostate cancer drug Pluvicto is in shortage but drugmaker Novartis says that the supply should increase in the second half of year. Some patients can't get access to the drug.

title: Iran-linked hackers broke into election results website in 2020, general says
description: Hackers working for Iran broke into a U.S. city’s website ahead of the 2020 election with the possible intention of altering the unofficial vote counts shown on election day, a senior military cyber official said Monday.

title: Big Tech crackdown looms as E.U., U.K. ready new rules
description: TikTok, Twitter, Facebook, Google, and Amazon are facing rising pressure from European authorities as London and Brussels advanced new rules Tuesday to curb the power of digital companies.

title: Manchin threatens to back repeal of major climate and tax measure over Biden's energy policies
description: Joe Manchin threatened to support repealing a climate, health and tax bill called the Inflation Reduction Act if Biden does not implement fossil fuel investments.

title: Americans rush to escape before Sudan plunges into civil war
description: Thousands of Americans are trying to evacuate the fighting in Sudan as the conflict between two rival generals threatens to explode into all-out civil war.

title: Harry Belafonte, singer, actor and civil rights champion, dies at 96
description: Harry Belafonte was at the forefront of human rights causes for more than 60 years, a legacy that sometimes overshadowed his brilliant music career.

title: A 13-year-old was groomed publicly on Twitter and kidnapped, even after his parents warned authorities
description: A 13-year-old boy was sexually groomed on Twitter after Elon Musk pledged to address child exploitation on the platform. Then he was abducted.

title: Why social media is calling Hollywood’s leading men ‘babygirl’
description: Some of Hollywood’s leading actors have been labeled as “babygirl” on social media, but according to experts, the name is actually meant as a compliment. NBC News’ Kalhan Rosenblatt explains where the trend began and why some language scholars are applauding the term.

title: Tucker Carlson is out at Fox News, but welcome in Russia
description: Tucker Carlson was offered work by Russian state media networks after Fox News announced his departure.

title: Ron DeSantis' trip abroad funded by group long despised by some Florida Republicans
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis’ global trade mission this week is being planned by an organization that fellow Republicans have been trying to eliminate.

title: AP Black history course will change after months of political discourse, College Board says
description: The College Board said in a statement Monday that it will commit to providing an “unflinching encounter with the facts.”

title: Biden's final campaign will put his economic vision to the test
description: Before Joe Biden opted against running for president in 2016, one of his closest advisers laid out what a bid would have looked like: an economic vision.

title: Massive turnover in local election officials likely before 2024, says new survey
description: A new survey from the Brennan Center for Justice at New York University School of Law predicts huge turnover in local election officials before 2024 election.

title: Biden announces he is running for re-election, framing 2024 as a choice between 'more rights or fewer'
description: Joe Biden announced he is running for president again in 2024 as a Democratic candidate. Among his challengers is Donald Trump, staying in despite his indictment.

title: Writer E. Jean Carroll’s rape allegation against Trump goes to trial in New York
description: Donald Trump's trial in E. Jean Carroll’s lawsuit begins today. The trial comes shortly after Trump’s indictment on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records.

title: SatanCon, poking at religion and government, opens this weekend in Boston
description: The Satanic Temple is celebrating 10 years of existence with its SatanCon convention in Boston this weekend, but it's not what you probably think.
